id: Wallabies next on the menu after Wales beat Scotland to win Doddie Weir Cup
paragraph:
Now that plates from the hors d’oeuvres have been cleared away, Wales are getting ready for the main course. If beating a Scotland side who have not won in Cardiff since 2002 and were thrashed 34-7 on their last visit hardly qualified as a surprise, Saturday’s encounter with the Wallabies is an altogether different proposition for a side who struggled to crank into top gear against the Scots.The final whistle had barely sounded before Wales coach Warren Gatland was casting his mind forward to the Aussies. You only need to look at Wales’ record against the Wallabies to appreciate how irritating the men in green and gold have become.
